Module jtrim.event.track
Package org.jtrim2.event.track

Class LinkedEventTracker

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.event.track.LinkedEventTracker
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventTracker
public final class LinkedEventTracker extends Object implements EventTracker
An EventTracker implementations which stores the causes in a singly linked list. Therefore, checking for the existence of a particular cause of an event requires every cause of the event to be checked.

This implementations can recognize the causality between events only by the mandatory ways defined by the EventTracker interface.

Thread safety

Methods of this class are safe to be accessed by multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

Methods of this class are synchronization transparent. Note that only the methods provided by this class are synchronization transparent, the TrackedListenerManager is not.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    LinkedEventTracker()
    Creates a new LinkedEventTracker which does not have a listener registered to any event and does not know about any event to be a cause.

  • Method Details

    • getManagerOfType

      public <ArgType> TrackedListenerManager<ArgType> getManagerOfType(Object eventKind, Class<ArgType> argType)
      Returns a TrackedListenerManager to which dispatched events can be keep tracked of by this EventTracker.

      The TrackedListenerManager is returned based on an event kind, which usually specifies a method of a listener interface and the type of arguments accepted by the listeners. In case TrackedListenerManager instances are requested multiple times using the same event kind and argument type, the returned TrackedListenerManager instances are functionally equivalent (although they may not necessarily equal based on their equals method).

      The onEvent method of the returned TrackedListenerManager will forward events to listeners registered to it. If the TrackedListenerManager is requested multiple times from this EventTracker registering a listener with or dispatching event to either of them has the same effect.

      Specified by:
      getManagerOfType in interface EventTracker
      Type Parameters:
      ArgType - the type of the argument accepted listeners of the returned TrackedListenerManager
      Parameters:
      eventKind - the kind of events can be possibly triggered by the returned TrackedListenerManager. This argument cannot be null.
      argType - the Class object defining the type of the arguments accepted by the listeners of the returned TrackedListenerManager. Note that for different argType objects, independent TrackedListenerManager instances are returned (i.e.: registering listeners to one of them does not affect the other and the same is with dispatching events) even if the class types are related (one is the subclass of the other). This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the TrackedListenerManager to which dispatched events can be keep tracked of by this EventTracker. This method never returns null.

    • createTrackedExecutor

      public TaskExecutor createTrackedExecutor(TaskExecutor executor)
      Returns an executor which submits tasks submitted to the to the executor specified but remembers the causing events from the time the task was submitted. That is, if the submitted (by the execute method of the returned executor) tasks calls the onEvent method of a TrackedListenerManager created by this EventTracker, it will have the same causes as if it had been called directly where the task was submitted to the executor.
      Specified by:
      createTrackedExecutor in interface EventTracker
      Parameters:
      executor - the executor to which tasks are forwarded to by the returned executor. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the executor which submits tasks submitted to the to the executor specified but remembers the causing events from the time the task was submitted. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • EventTracker.createTrackedExecutorService(TaskExecutorService)

    • createTrackedExecutorService

      public TaskExecutorService createTrackedExecutorService(TaskExecutorService executor)
      Returns an executor which submits tasks submitted to the to the executor specified but remembers the causing events from the time the task was submitted. That is, if the submitted (by the execute or submit, etc. methods of the returned executor) tasks calls the onEvent method of a TrackedListenerManager created by this EventTracker, it will have the same causes as if it had been called directly where the task was submitted to the executor.
      Specified by:
      createTrackedExecutorService in interface EventTracker
      Parameters:
      executor - the executor to which tasks are forwarded to by the returned executor. This argument cannot be null.
      Returns:
      the executor which submits tasks submitted to the to the executor specified but remembers the causing events from the time the task was submitted. This method never returns null.
      See Also:
      • EventTracker.createTrackedExecutor(TaskExecutor)
